intro: Xylopia quintasii, commonly known as the Madagascar nutmeg. It is a member of the Annonaceae family and is native to Madagascar. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height. Its fruit is a globose capsule that contains aromatic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. The plant's botanical features include dark green, glossy leaves and a distinctive, fragrant aroma.
